intro: Ceratocnemum rapistroides, commonly known as the African sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, yellowish flowers. The plant thrives in sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its unique morphology includes a branching stem and a distinctive, umbrella-like inflorescence. It is often used in traditional medicine and has ornamental value in dryland gardens.
